page.title: 04EDUCATION 1
page.content: We visited 3 Primary schools and one playgroup with some great differences but also some amazing similarities. Approx. 4000 children go to school in the Crowboro' area. Jarvis Brook has 337 children aged between 4_11. There are 13 full & 4 part_time teachers who teach a wide range of subjects includ_ ing cookery. Rotherfield was a small school with only 148 pupils with 6 full & 3 part_time teachers. However they have 3 computers and an outdoor swimming pool. Fermor the largest and oldest school, opened in 1744 with money left in Sir Henry Fermor's will, has 450 pupils. All Saints playgroup, opened in 1969, has 60 children aged 2 _5, 30 attending each morning. They are taught simple lessons & also play. We discovered that the larger schools often had less facilities than smaller schools. Why is this so?
